turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm thinking of joining a hackathon, but I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed. I don't even know where to start looking for one!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hi there! I understand feeling overwhelmed. There are many hackathons out there. To help narrow it down, what kind of projects are you interested in, and what's your skill level (beginner, intermediate, advanced)?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, I'm mostly interested in web development or AI/ML projects. I'd say I'm at an intermediate level with web dev, but pretty much a beginner with AI/ML. It's something I'm learning on the side. What's even a good beginner project for AI at a hackathon?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay! For an AI/ML beginner project at a hackathon, you could consider building a simple image classifier (like identifying different types of flowers) using a pre-trained model, or a sentiment analysis tool for tweets. These are quite popular. I can search for hackathons based on your interests. How about looking for online hackathons?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Online would be great! Also, this might be a dumb question, but how do you usually handle team formation at these things? I'm worried about ending up with a group where nobody knows what they're doing or everyone has wildly different ideas.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a valid concern! Most hackathons will have some kind of team formation event, either online or in person. This could be a speed-networking session, or a dedicated channel on their communication platform (like Discord). I suggest reaching out to the organizers beforehand and inquiring about the team formation process, they may be able to tell you a little more.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that makes sense. Thanks! Can you find me some beginner friendly, online hackathons that include AI/ML themes? Hopefully, the team formation process is well-organized.
